title: The One With The Hypnosis Tape

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, all but Chandler are there, Joey laughs for no apparent reason.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to Joey) What’s so funny?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh, nothing, no. It’s an acting exercise, I’m practising my fake laugh.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh. (she laughs)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What-what’s so funny?

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: (to Chandler) Oh, no-no, no-no-no, there’s none of that in here.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh come on man! At least let me finish this last one.

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: Okay, but only if you give me a drag.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: GUNTHER
dialogue.text: Oh dark mother, once again I suckle at your smokey tit. (hands Chandler back the cigarette.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No-no, why don’t you hang on to that one.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, that’s like the least fun game ever.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, I’m really sick of your smoking, so I brought something that is going to help you quit. (hands him an audio cassette)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh. (takes the cassette and puts it on his arm like the stop smoking patch, and it falls off.) Nope, that patch is no good. (Joey and Monica both do their fake laughs.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Come on, it’s a hypnosis tape. This woman at work used it for two weeks straight and she hasn’t smoked since.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pffhah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (to Ross) What’s your problem?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Nothing, it’s just that hypnosis is beyond crap.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ross, I watched you get hypnotised in Atlantic City.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey, that guy did not hypnotise me! Okay.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh right, ‘cause you always pull your pants down at the count of three and play Wipe-out on your butt cheeks.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: All right, y'know forget hypnosis. The way to quit smoking is you have to dance naked in a field of heather, and then bath in the sweat of six healthy young men.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Or what my Father called Thursday night.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, all but Chandler are there, Joey laughs for no apparent reason.]

events.event_description: Joey laughs for no apparent reason, practicing his fake laugh during the scene.
Monica questions Joey about his laughter.
Monica laughs at Joey's explanation of his fake laugh.
Gunther confronts Chandler about smoking in the coffeehouse.
Chandler agrees to give Gunther a drag of his cigarette.
Gunther hands Chandler a cigarette and recites a dark invocation.
Rachel offers Chandler a hypnosis cassette to help him quit smoking.
Chandler attempts to use the cassette as a stop-smoking patch, but it falls off.
Rachel criticizes Ross's skepticism about hypnosis.
Phoebe suggests an absurd method involving dancing naked in a field of heather to quit smoking.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, continued from earlier, Ross is handing Rachel a cup of coffee.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Here you go.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, y'know what, I didn’t want cinnamon on this.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Sorry. (To remedy that, Ross scoops the cinnamon off of the top with his hand.)

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh my God!!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Frank! Hi!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: How are you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What are you doing here?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Oh, well y'know, I would’ve called but I lost your phone number and then ah, my Mom locked me out of the house so I couldn’t find it. And then, I tried to find a pay phone, and ah, the receiver was cut off. So...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What happened?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Ah, oh, the ah, vandalism.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: But, also, what happened between you and your Mom?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Well, we got into a fight ‘cause ah, she said I was to immature to get married.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Your getting married?!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Wow!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: My little brother’s getting married!!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Oh, I knew you’d be so cool about this. All right, ah, hey, do you want to meet her?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Do I?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Do you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I do, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Okay, cool, all right, she just ah, parking the truck. (to Joey) I’m gonna, I’m gonna get my ah, my fiancée man!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, I would’ve bet good money that he’d be the first one of us to get married.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, isn’t it fantastic?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, ah, but Pheebs don’t you think he’s a little young to get married?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What, he’s 18.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Exactly, it’ll be illegal for him to drink at his own bachelor party.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, or-or to get a hooker.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Always illegal Joe.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: (entering with his fiancée Alice, who is obviously much, much older than he is) Hey! Hey! This is ah, my fiancée, Mrs. Knight. (he points out Phoebe to her)

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Y'know it-it’s funny, um, Frank told me so much about you, but your not how I pictured you at all.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I’m a big surprise.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: So, um, how-how did you guys meet?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Well um, I was in ah Mrs. Knight’s ah, I mean Alice, sorry, Alice, I always do that. I was in her ah, Home Ec class.

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: And he was my best student.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Yeah, she was my best teacher.

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Ohhh. (They embrace in a very passionate kiss.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: If that doesn’t keep kids in school, what will?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And so now you guys are gonna be married?

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Yeah. Y'know we-we talked about just living together, but um, we want to have kids right away.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God!! Great!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wow, kids. Frank, are you sure you’re ready for that?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: I mean, how hard can it be? Y'know, I mean, y'know, babies, y'know who doesn’t want babies right? And besides y'know, I never had a Dad around, and ah, now-now I always will, ‘cause y'know, it’ll be me. Right?

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Y'know, I mean, really we do realise that there’s an age difference between us.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh good! Okay. ‘Cause you were acting like you didn’t.

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Oh no, but when it comes to love, what does age matter?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Central Perk, continued from earlier, Ross is handing Rachel a cup of coffee.]

events.event_description: Ross hands Rachel a cup of coffee.
Ross scoops the cinnamon off of the coffee with his hand to remove it.
Frank enters Central Perk and greets Phoebe.
Frank explains he couldn't call Phoebe because he lost her phone number and was locked out of his house.
Frank mentions he tried to find a pay phone but the receiver was cut off.
Frank announces he is getting married to Alice.
Frank introduces Alice as his fiancée to Phoebe.
Alice and Frank share a passionate kiss after discussing their relationship.
Alice states she and Frank want to have kids immediately.
Phoebe questions Frank about being ready for having children due to his age and background.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler’s bedroom, Chandler is listening to the hypnosis tape.]

dialogue.speaker: HYPNOSIS TAPE
dialogue.text: You are falling fast asleep. Deeper. Deeper. Deeper. You are now completely asleep. You don’t need to smoke. Cigarettes don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. A strong, confident woman.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler’s bedroom, Chandler is listening to the hypnosis tape.]

events.event_description: Chandler is listening to the hypnosis tape in his bedroom.
The hypnosis tape plays a series of commands encouraging relaxation and confidence.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: The Moondance Diner, Monica is working, Rachel is having lunch.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And y'know what, I just realised, in the last year I’ve only gone out with two guys, Richard and Julio. You gotta help me out here, you gotta set me up, you gotta get me back in the game.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, that shouldn’t be a problem. I mean I work in fashion and all I meet are eligible straight men.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (to a customer) Pete, can I get you something else?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Yeah, a slice of cheesecake and-and a date if you’re given’ ‘em out.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Haven’t you and I covered that topic?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Hmm, come on, you just said to her that you….

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Aww, the only reason you want to go out with me because my blond wig, and the big boobs, and the fact that I serve you food.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Well, if that were true, I’d dating my Aunt Ruth. And the two times we went out were just plain awkward. (to Rachel) Come on, you think she should go out with me, don’t you?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (laughs) Well, I mean, are you sure you want to go out with her? I mean that ain’t a pretty picture in the morning, y’know what I mean. That wig all in disarray, and boobs flung over the night stand, y'know.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I mean really, think about it.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Ho-ho, I will.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: The Moondance Diner, Monica is working, Rachel is having lunch.]

events.event_description: Monica tells Rachel she has only dated two guys in the past year and asks for help to get back in the dating scene.
Rachel responds that she works in fashion and mostly meets eligible straight men.
Monica asks Pete if she can get him something else.
Pete jokingly asks for a slice of cheesecake and a date from Monica.
Monica questions Pete about whether he has discussed dating her before.
Pete jokes that Monica only wants to date him because of her wig, big boobs, and serving food.
Pete claims he would be dating his Aunt Ruth if his intentions were superficial, and comments on their past awkward dates.
Pete asks Rachel if she thinks Monica should go out with him.
Rachel humorously questions what Monica's mornings would be like if they dated, mentioning her wig and boobs.
Pete responds affirmatively to Rachel's comment, indicating he will consider it.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are being lectured by Phoebe.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I know, I know, that this is Frank’s life, (walks behind them, they turn around in the leather chairs to face her) y'know. Y'know, I don’t want to be all judgmental, y'know, but this is sick, it’s sick and wrong!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pheebs, what, is it the age thing?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No-no, oh, I’m fine with the age thing y'know, until it starts sticking it’s tongue down my little brother’s throat!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Pheebs, he seems to enjoy it.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: But, I mean, do you think he’s gonna enjoy it when he’s up to his elbows in the diapers from all the babies they have to have right away?! This is not fair to Frank, (she walks behind them again, and hey again turn to follow her) and it-it’s not fair to the babies, and y'know what, it’s not good home economics.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, have-have you told him how you feel?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes. Not out loud.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Pheebs, if you don’t tell him, soon he’s gonna be married, and then you’re gonna hate yourself.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but if I do tell him, then he’s gonna hate myself. I mean look at him and his Mom, I can’t. (pause) But, you guys can, please you gotta talk him out of it.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND JOEY
dialogue.text: No-no-no-no-no. (They start to turn away, but Phoebe stops them, and turns them back to face her.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Come on, you guys, you have nothing to lose, I have everything to lose. Do you want me to lose everything? Everything?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND JOEY
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, I’m gonna go get Frank. (exits)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So, we’re walking down the street and I turn to you and I say, “Hey, let’s go hang out at Totally Nude Nudes,” remember? And then, and then, you turn to me and say, “Nah, let’s just hang out at your place.” Well, that was a nice move dumb ass.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are being lectured by Phoebe.]

events.event_description: Phoebe walks behind Ross and Joey while they are seated in leather chairs and begins criticizing Frank’s life choices.
Ross asks Phoebe if her concern is related to the age difference between Frank and his partner.
Phoebe expresses her disapproval of Frank’s relationship, specifically mentioning the physical affection.
Joey comments that Phoebe's brother seems to enjoy the relationship.
Phoebe worries about the consequences of Frank’s relationship on his future and the babies, and states it’s not good home economics.
Phoebe admits she has not openly expressed her feelings to Frank.
Ross advises Phoebe that if she doesn’t tell Frank soon, he might regret it after marriage.
Phoebe expresses her fear that telling Frank will cause him to hate her, citing his relationship with his mother.
Phoebe decides to go get Frank, indicating her intention to confront him.
Joey recounts a humorous story about walking down the street and discussing hanging out at a nude club, ending with a teasing remark to Chandler.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Monica are entering.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I think you should definitely go out with this guy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Nah, he doesn’t do anything for me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica, last Saturday night,

dialogue.speaker: WHAT HAPPENED ON WALKER
dialogue.text: Texas Ranger ?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, umm, Walker was looking for this big bus load of kids…. (realises) All right, I get your point.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (entering, carrying a briefcase) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know, I forgot the combination to this about a year ago? I just carry it around. Do you have any Chap Stick?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Uh, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey, how are those tapes working out for ya?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'know what, pretty good.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Good! I haven’t smoked yet today, I feel great, and-and-and confident, that is a stunning blouse.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Here you go.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thanks

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hey Mon, let’s give Pete a chance Come on, he was funny, he seems really nice, and that check thing was adorable.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What check thing?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: As a joke, this customer at work who has a crush on me gave me a $20,000 tip. His number is on the check, he just did so I’d call him.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (reading the check) Pete Becker. Pete… (quickly grabs a magazine and opens it up to show her a picture) (pointing to the picture) Is this him?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That’s Bill Clinton.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Who’s he huggin’?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God! That’s Pete! But why is Bill huggin’ Pete?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: This guy invented Moss 865! Every office in the world uses that program!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: We use it!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: There you go!!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God, Monica’s gonna go out with a millionaire.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I’m not gonna go out with him.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God, I can’t believe this is a real $20,000 check, oh this is just so exciting.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Or incredibly offensive.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, sure, that too.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to the girls who are staring at him) What?

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Monica are entering.]

events.event_description: Rachel suggests Monica should go out with a certain guy.
Monica declines the invitation, saying the guy doesn’t do anything for her.
Rachel mentions last Saturday night and references 'Walker, Texas Ranger'.
Monica explains that Walker was looking for a busload of kids, then realizes Rachel's point.
Chandler enters the scene carrying a briefcase and greets Monica and Rachel.
Chandler mentions he forgot the combination to his briefcase and asks Monica for Chap Stick.
Rachel asks Chandler about the tapes he is using, and Chandler responds positively.
Chandler comments on feeling confident and compliments Rachel’s blouse.
Rachel suggests giving Pete a chance, citing his humor and kindness, and the check he gave as a joke.
Chandler notices the check and identifies Pete Becker, showing a picture of Bill Clinton and questioning who he is hugging.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are talking to Frank.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: All we’re saying is don’t rush into anything.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, come on, think about it. You’re 18, okay, she’s 44, when you’re 36, she’s gonna be 88.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: What, you don’t think I know that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Look, the point is, there’s a lot of women out there you haven’t even had sex with yet!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, he-he’s right, he’s right. This is your time y'know, yeah, you’re young, you’re-you’re weird, chicks dig that.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Okay, but isn’t sex better when it’s with one person that you really, really care about.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, in a poem maybe.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No the man’s right, that’s what I had with Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: You don’t have it anymore?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, I ah, I slept with someone else.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Okay, so wait, all right, so how does that make things better?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It didn’t.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Okay, so what you used to have with Rachel, is what I’ve got with Alice.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Now, wh-what, what is that like?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: It’s so cool man, it’s so, it’s just ‘cause being with her is so much better than like not being with her.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (to Ross) Why can’t I find that?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Don’t ask me, I had it and I blew it!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I want it!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: You can have it!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don’t know, maybe I can’t. I mean, maybe there’s something wrong with me.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, no! No!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: It’s out there man! I’ve seen it! I got it!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Then you hold on to it!!

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: All right, man!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: All right, congratulations you lucky bastard! (hugs him)

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are talking to Frank.]

events.event_description: Ross advises Joey not to rush into a relationship.
Joey argues that Ross's age difference with his girlfriend is problematic.
Frank questions whether sex is better with someone he cares about.
Ross admits to sleeping with someone else after his relationship with Rachel.
Frank compares his relationship with Alice to Ross's past with Rachel.
Joey expresses his desire to find a meaningful relationship.
Ross encourages Joey to hold on to love when he finds it.
Frank assures Joey that love and a good relationship are out there for him.
Joey expresses his frustration and desire to find love.
Joey hugs Frank in celebration of his relationship advice.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, it’s after Ross and Joey’s talk with Frank, and
Phoebe’s is finding out what happened.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Joey) You’re Frank’s best man?!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I couldn’t help it, there love is so pure.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well then, (to Ross) what about you?! Huh?!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I’m the ring bearer.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, it’s after Ross and Joey’s talk with Frank, and
Phoebe’s is finding out what happened.]

events.event_description: Phoebe questions Joey about him being Frank's best man.
Joey responds that he couldn't help it because their love is pure.
Phoebe asks Ross about his role in the wedding.
Ross states that he is the ring bearer.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s, Phoebe is opening the door.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hi! Oh, Alice, hi! Thanks. I’m so glad you could come, ‘cause I’ve got a real umm, Home Ec emergency. (Points to the table cloth, which has a huge mustard stain on it.)

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Oh my God, who died on this?!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, I know. It’s a real mustard-tastrophe. Can you help me?

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Absolutely. Okay, first we’ll start with a little club soda and salt, and then if that doesn’t work we can go back to…

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Y'know what, forget it. It’s ruined.

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Oh no-no, never say that. If we can’t get it out then we can cut around the stain, add a little lace, you make a stylish throw.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Or instead, maybe you could just not marry my brother Frank.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Phoebe’s, Phoebe is opening the door.]

events.event_description: Phoebe opens the door to welcome Alice into her home.
Phoebe greets Alice and expresses relief that she could come.
Phoebe points to the tablecloth with a large mustard stain and explains the emergency.
Alice reacts with surprise and comments on the stain, calling it a 'mustard-tastrophe'.
Alice suggests using club soda and salt to remove the stain.
Phoebe dismisses the stain as ruined and gives up on cleaning it.
Alice proposes cutting around the stain and adding lace to make a stylish throw.
Phoebe sarcastically suggests Alice could not marry her brother Frank as an alternative solution.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Pete’s office, he is participating in a conference call with three other
employees, each of whom are on a different TV screen that he controls with a remote.]

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Okay, that’s great, but can we make it smaller? Can we make it fit on the head of a pin? I love when we make things fit on the head of a pin.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Got it. Yeah all right. Yeah, okay.

dialogue.speaker: SECRETARY
dialogue.text: You have a Miss Monica Geller here.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Uh, absolutely, yeah, sEnd her in. (Monica enters) Hi.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What the hell is this? (holding up the check)

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Hang on a second. (to the employees) I’ll-I’ll talk to you in the morning. (turns two of the three off) I’m sorry what?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Seriously, what is this supposed to mean?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Well, y’know, I never know how much to tip.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You’re supposed to double the tax. Not double the tax of Romania. I mean, what’s-what’s the deal? Are you, are you trying to buy me? Is this the way you get girls to go out with you?

dialogue.speaker: EMPLOYEE
dialogue.text: Umm, I’m still here.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: (turns off the TV) You’re taking this all wrong. Because, if I didn’t leave you that tip, you wouldn’t of come down here, we wouldn’t be having this argument, and there wouldn’t be this ah, heat between us.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Come on, you gotta admit that our relationship is ah, is hitting a new level now. ‘Cause you used to be like the chef, and I was the customer, and now we’re like this-this couple that fights.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, umm, you’re a loon.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Look, forget the check, okay. (rips up the check) I like you. I think you’re great. Come on, what do you say?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don’t know.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ‘Cause I don’t want to encourage this kind of behaviour.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: One meal! That’s all I’m asking for. Please? We go out, we eat, and if you don’t have a good time, I give you ten grand, we call it even.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Pete’s office, he is participating in a conference call with three other
employees, each of whom are on a different TV screen that he controls with a remote.]

events.event_description: Pete participates in a conference call with three employees on different TV screens in his office.
Pete asks the employees if they can make the content smaller to fit on the head of a pin.
Secretary informs Pete that Monica Geller is waiting to see him.
Monica enters Pete's office holding up a check, questioning its meaning.
Pete turns off two of the three TV screens during the conversation with Monica.
Pete explains to Monica that he left a tip to ensure she came down to talk to him.
Pete suggests that their relationship is evolving into a more confrontational dynamic, comparing it to a couple fighting.
Pete rips up the check and confesses his feelings to Monica, expressing admiration.
Monica hesitates, expressing concern about encouraging Pete's behavior.
Pete pleads with Monica to go out for a meal, offering money if she doesn't enjoy it.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Phoebe’s, she is coming home. She turns on the lights, and sits down on
the couch.]

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: (hiding under a pile of clothes) Hi. (She jumps up screaming.) Wait, no! Just put the mail down. It’s-it’s me!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. Whoa, sorry. Why were you just like all in the dark?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Oh well, um, your, your laundry just smelled so good, that I thought I’d curl up in it. Is that all right?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah, sure. So, how was your day?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Oh, well just probably the worst one since I’ve been alive.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What umm, what happened?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Umm, Alice ah, she ah, called it off.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh no. Did umm, did she say why?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Uh, no, not really, just that I was too young, y'know, but I don’t see how I could all of the sudden be too young, ‘cause I’m older than I was when we first got together.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, no, I don’t, I don’t know. But, y'know what, maybe it’s just all for the best?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Yeah, if the best is like unbelievable pain!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, sweetie, oh. (hugs him)

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Y'know, I just was finally happy y'know. For the first time in my life! After my Dad left me, and then, and then getting arrested for stealing those birds, and then, and then the whole punctured lung thing! I can, it’s still really hard to take deep breaths in cold weather, but with Alice all that stuff kinda went away. And now it’s, and now it’s gone and I don’t know why!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Uh, well I can tell you why. It’s, it’s because of me. But, y'know what, I only did it because I love you. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Umm, well I, I kinda had a little chat with Alice, and I sort of made her see why you two shouldn’t be together, y'know. And you’re gonna see it to, one day, you really, really will.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, wait, this is because of you?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Well, you, wait no, my Mother didn’t want us to be together, but the worst thing she ever did was tie me to the porch.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, but.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Wait, y'know what, I-I came to you because I thought you’d understand! Oh no!! Y'know, I would storm out of here right now if-if I had some money, or a place to go…

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Phoebe’s, she is coming home. She turns on the lights, and sits down on
the couch.]

events.event_description: Phoebe turns on the lights and sits down on the couch at her home.
Frank, hiding under a pile of clothes, greets Phoebe and asks her to put down the mail.
Phoebe jumps up screaming upon seeing Frank hiding under the clothes.
Frank explains he was in the laundry because it smelled good and asks if that's okay.
Frank reveals that his day was the worst since he’s been alive, due to Alice calling off their relationship.
Frank states that Alice said he was too young to be with her, despite being older than when they first got together.
Phoebe suggests that perhaps the breakup is for the best.
Frank expresses his pain and recounts past hardships, feeling finally happy before the breakup.
Phoebe admits she caused the breakup because she loves Frank and talked to Alice to end their relationship.
Frank reacts with surprise and frustration, feeling betrayed and wishing he had money or a place to go.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting Monica ready for her date. The guys are
also there. The door buzzes.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God! The millionaire’s here!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (in a feminine way) Oh my God! (and he jumps all around)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Guys, please, I’m just gonna have dinner with him. Okay?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, just because he buys you dinner, does not mean you owe him anything.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I know!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, then get the lobster!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (opening the door) (to Pete) Hey!

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Hi.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hi!!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hi!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey, how much cash do you got in your pocket right now?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And that’s why, I’m not inviting you in for a drink. (starts to leave) Bye.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh-no-no-no-no….

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Just one drink?!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (in the hallway) So, where do you want to go?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Hey, you like pizza?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that’s sounds great.

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: I know a great little place.

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting Monica ready for her date. The guys are
also there. The door buzzes.]

events.event_description: Rachel exclaims that the millionaire is here.
Chandler reacts in a feminine way and jumps around upon hearing the news.
Monica requests the guys to let her prepare for her date.
Chandler comments that just because the guy buys dinner, Monica doesn't owe him anything.
Monica responds that she knows she doesn't owe him anything.
Chandler jokes about getting lobster for Monica.
Monica opens the door and greets Pete.
Rachel, Joey, and Ross greet Pete as he arrives.
Joey asks Pete how much cash he has in his pocket.
Monica decides not to invite Joey in for a drink and starts to leave.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A restaurant in Rome, Monica is paying for the pizza.]

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: You’re, hey, you’re not paying for the pizza!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh come on, it’s only fair, you paid for the flight. Now is, is that enough lire?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: Ahh, I’d throw another thousand on that.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why, how much is that?

dialogue.speaker: PETE
dialogue.text: That’s about 60 cents.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: A restaurant in Rome, Monica is paying for the pizza.]

events.event_description: Monica begins paying for the pizza at the restaurant in Rome.
Pete protests that Monica is not paying for the pizza.
Monica insists she should pay because Pete paid for the flight.
Pete offers to add an additional thousand lire to the payment.
Monica asks Pete how much the additional amount is.
Pete states that the additional amount is about 60 cents.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, it’s the middle of the night. Joey is walking into
the living room, and runs into the entertainment centre.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Every night!!

dialogue.speaker: HYPNOSIS TAPE
dialogue.text: You do not need to smoke. Cigarettes don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. A strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. (Joey walks out smiling to himself.)

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, it’s the middle of the night. Joey is walking into
the living room, and runs into the entertainment centre.]

events.event_description: Joey walks into the living room and runs into the entertainment centre.
Joey exclaims 'Every night!!'
Hypnosis tape plays a recording encouraging a woman to not smoke and to feel confident.
Joey walks out of the scene smiling to himself after listening to the hypnosis tape.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Phoebe’s, Frank is watching TV, and he’s very depressed as Phoebe
enters.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, Frank. Look, okay, I know that you think I did like this totally evil thing, but I so didn’t. There’s someone here who can explain this better than I can.

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Hi Frank.

dialogue.speaker: FRANK
dialogue.text: Hi, Mrs. Knight.

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Phoebe’s right Frank. I know it’s hard to hear, but it would’ve been wrong to go through with it. I-I-I was being selfish, even though we, we want the same things now, in the future we may not. (to Phoebe) Is that it, is that what it is?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, but not just that.

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: Right, not just that. Umm, even though we love each other as much as we do, none the less…

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: None the less.

dialogue.speaker: ALICE
dialogue.text: None the less. Umm, you’re too young to, to really know what you want. (They embrace in a passionate kiss.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: That’s right, exactly. (sees them) All right, it’s a good bye kiss, that’s good. (Frank picks Alice up and they move to the couch) Bye-bye. (They both lie down on the couch and start to make out.) Okay, no, the important thing is that you see what I’m saying, y'know, just y'know, this is clearly wrong. (They ignore her) Okay, I’ve decided I’m gonna let this happen! Okay, can I just get my purse? (She reaches in and Alice moans) Okay, all right, good. (leaves).

scenes.event_description:
[Scene: Phoebe’s, Frank is watching TV, and he’s very depressed as Phoebe
enters.]

events.event_description: Phoebe enters the scene at Phoebe's, where Frank is watching TV and appears depressed.
Phoebe attempts to explain to Frank that she did not do something evil, and mentions someone who can clarify the situation.
Alice greets Frank and acknowledges Phoebe's perspective, suggesting it was wrong to proceed with a certain action.
Alice admits she was being selfish and questions whether Phoebe's feelings are justified, implying a discussion about a past decision.
Alice and Phoebe discuss the nature of their love and Phoebe's youth, leading to Alice and Phoebe embracing in a passionate kiss.
Phoebe observes Alice and Frank embracing and comments that it is a goodbye kiss, then Frank and Alice move to the couch and start making out.
Phoebe asserts that the situation is clearly wrong and decides to let it happen, then attempts to retrieve her purse.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler’s bedroom, he’s listening to the hypnosis tape again.]

dialogue.speaker: HYPNOSIS TAPE
dialogue.text: Cigarette’s don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (He’s recorded his voice on the tape) Joey’s your best friEnd. You want to make him a cheese sandwich everyday. (he laughs) And you also want to buy him hundreds of dollars worth of pants.

scenes.event_description: [Scene: Chandler’s bedroom, he’s listening to the hypnosis tape again.]

events.event_description: Chandler listens to the hypnosis tape in his bedroom.
HYPNOSIS TAPE plays a suggestion that cigarettes don't control the listener and that she is a confident woman who doesn't need to smoke.
Joey records his voice on the hypnosis tape, stating that she is Joey's best friend and wants to make him a cheese sandwich every day.
Joey laughs while recording his voice on the tape, mentioning buying him hundreds of dollars worth of pants.
